definition: will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])
to win a prize/a successful gamble
to announce the winners in a lottery
to draw a prize/a lottery/a raffle

sentences.chinese: 他的《詩作全集》1951年獲普利策詩作獎。

sentences.english: He took six college level courses during his four high school years, and received numerous awards.
sentences.chinese: 他在高中四年中修了六門大學課程，得過多項獎。

sentences.english: The causeway, finished just 10 years ago, has won engineering awards.
sentences.chinese: 銅鑼灣在10年前竣工，獲得了工程獎。

sentences.english: With respect to this character, completely OK with the United States house award is rivalled on the west.
sentences.chinese: 就這一點而言，完全可以與美國的西屋獎媲美。

sentences.english: Susannah won the calligraphy prize when she was at school.
sentences.chinese: 蘇珊娜上學時贏得了書法獎。

sentences.english: She said studying English helped her get the prize.
sentences.chinese: 她說就是學習英語幫助她得到了這個獎。

sentences.english: Chen Daoming received the Best Performance award for his role in the film.
sentences.chinese: 陳道明憑藉在此片中的演出獲最佳男演員獎。

sentences.english: Tom won a prize for good behavior at school.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆在學校裏得到品行優良獎。

sentences.english: What we can do for rotary club?
sentences.chinese: 獎學生能爲扶輪社友做什麼？

sentences.english: I got this prize early than you.
Selection of Distinguished Teachers is a two-stage process.
sentences.chinese: 挑選卓越教學獎獲獎者的程序分爲兩步。

sentences.english: National Rail awards won by Serco Docklands Ltd.
sentences.chinese: 謝科碼頭區有限公司再度贏得國家鐵路獎。

sentences.english: This research is also supported by a Seeding Drug Discovery Award from the Wellcome Trust.
sentences.chinese: 本研究也得到了“藥物研發維康基金會獎”的支持。

sentences.english: Maple Garden won the Award of the Top 10 Star Areas of Beijing in 2000.
sentences.chinese: 東潤風景曾榮獲2000年北京市十大明星樓盤獎。

sentences.english: In fact, my cholesterol numbers could win me awards.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，我的膽固醇高的可以讓我拿獎。

definition: to promulgate/to send out/to issue/to grant or confer
special glory/distinction/rare honor/one's laurels/it's a privilege (to meet you)
to get past the qualifying round/to make it to the finals
